data.title: Wonderful acoustics and beautiful space
data.text: Attended a choir concert of the Kansas State Men's Glee Club and Allegro Childrens Choirs of Kansas City as part of their Great Spaces series.  Wonderful to see these young people perform with so much energy and pride in a beautiful classic cathedral with fantastic acoustics.

data.title: Incredible stained glass
data.text:
I stopped by late on a Friday afternoon (about 3 o'clock) when I was passing through Topeka during a recent business trip. 

I figured the cathedral would be closed, but the office was open and a lady (I presume a secretary) was kind enough to let me into the cathedral with no questions asked. This was nice, as you'd be surprised how much churches and cathedrals aren't welcoming to visitors outside of worship times. 

This is a very nice cathedral that's relatively new. The building itself is about a hundred years old, but it looks much newer. That's because a fire devastated the interior of the cathedral in the 1970s. Everything you see inside dates from then, though they have a done a nice job at using traditional decor.

The stained glass windows are very nice. There are also some handy visitor guides. 

From a secular standpoint, it's worth a visit if you're into architecture. From a religious standpoint, services are somewhat limited. Unfortunately, there's no daily evensong.

data.title: Beautiful Church and Stained Glass Windows
data.text: Across the street from the Kansas state capitol, this church has beautiful architecture and many gorgeous stained glass windows. There was nobody there to give us a tour, but we were allowed to roam the church freely and enjoy the beautiful workmanship.Highly recommended, especially if you love stained glass.
